name: El Colibri Hotel and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night and had the most amazing massages in the spa. We met friends in the wine bar and had a lovely cheese plate. The wines are all local. Staff were very friendly and helpful.It was my significant other's birthday and staff put rose petals in the room with a bottle of wine I had requested and a lovely note to him confirming his surprise massage. The masseuses were very well trained and a delight to work with. Do the hot rock massage and do 90 minutes. You won't be disappointed. We had dinner at the sea chest to top it all off. I can't wait to go back.Room had a fireplace and large lighted mirror for applying make up!
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent service and room. Location is midway between Moonstone Beach and shops/restaurants...kind of like in no-man's land. Not directly across the beach. Need to cross Hwy 1 to get to restaurants and shops. Other than that, the service was excellent and complimentary breakfast was quite satisfying (fruits, pastry, etc). The rooms with Queen and King bed has a semi-partitioning wall which gives some privacy when travelling with kids. The room itself was spacious, clean, and comfortable.
reviews.title: very good hotel, only drawback is location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights in an executive jacuzzi room facing the back of the hotel which is what I requested. Total silence and no noise could be heard so for light sleepers the back is very quiet - the windows are very well insulated so I would imagine the same is true at the front. Plenty of free parking at the hotel and also free Wifi. Breakfast is ok - its enough to get you started for the day - no hot options mainly cereal, breads, juice, yoghurt, fruit. Lovely beaches/walks/boardwalk 3 minutes from the hotel - turn left when you exit the hotel and you cant miss it. Lovely walks and a nice place to relax. Cute little grey ground squirrels all along the boardwalk which goes on for maybe 2 miles. The hotel is across the road from the town of Cambria which is really in 2 sections - the first part is like a 3-5 minute walk the second part maybe 15 minutes. Everything closes early in both sections of the town. This was our first stop having a lovely drive down from SF so it was great to relax here for 2 nights. The rooms in the hotel are beautiful - very high standards and very new and large. Didn't do the wine tasting as i'm not sure if it was on when we visited. For European visitors expecting big spa facilities they may want to make enquiries but I believe the only spa features are the outdoor Jacuzzi, and a steam room that would burn your feet as its one of those instant steam type ones. Many hotels we visited in California that were spa hotels but they would not have anything like the range of spa services available in European hotels so just be advised of this. It's not a criticism of the hotel as many of the hotels we stayed in had spa's attached with just the same facilities. The jacuzzi in El Colibri is outdoor and open 24 hours I think which is really good. Didn't try any treatments so could not comment. All in all very good and would recommend and would stay again if in this lovely area. One word of thanks to the manager I think his name was Tanu or Tonu - very helpful, friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Cambria last week and stayed at El Colibri and even though they allowed pets they are not really pet friendly facility. The hotel has only been open for two years but yet the in room TV already needs to be replaced but the bed is very comfortable. The staff is friendly but they don't go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. We did utilize their "spa" and my husband and I had massages but its not a full service spa. They do not have facials, scrubs, etc....
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel but will probably not stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Cambria is a beautiful place to visit for a long weekend, very relaxing but I think I will find a better place to stay that is more pet friendly hotel.
reviews.title: I will stat here every time I need a get away with my wife!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove from LA to San Francisco on hwy 101 and then jumped on hwy 1 for the rest of the trip and El Colibri was a great halfway point stop.The hotel is very nice and the people were very friendly.We watched a little fawn out of our window.You can walk a boardwalk to the beach,thou it was cool and very windy.Don't miss bar b que chicken at the Main Street Grill in Cambria it was great.
reviews.title: Great Halfway Stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have no words to describe our wonderful stay at this hotel. It was quiet, clean with a homey atmosphere. The breakfast spread was plentiful, fresh and delicious. The hotel staff was polite and helpful with setting up our trip to Hearst Castle. If you're traveling down the Pacific Coast or just looking for the perfect getaway, we highly recommend the El Colibri in Cambria, CA. Judy and David, Jerusalem, Israel
reviews.title: The best stay ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice spacious room with fireplace, clean and comfortable. Stylish design, robes. Nice point to stop on the road.
reviews.title: Nice hotel on the coast way from LA to San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is less than 3 years old -- the only new hotel in Cambria. Very nice clean rooms, excellent service , good continental breakfast. Convenient location -- close to the ocean and to the village. I would suggest it as a good home base to explore the Paso Robles area wineries.
reviews.title: New in Cambria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival at this hispanic looking hotel you feel as if it has been deliberately hidden amidst the foliage that leads from the hotel to the beach. If it has been hidden, then finding it was an enjoyable treat. The manager greeted and checked us with effortless aplomb. Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable but unfortunately was only for the one night.
reviews.title: Hidden jewel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Cambria is way off the beaten path near Hearst Castle so I guess one could expect that you may not be able to get a cell signal here or in the surrounding area. The hotel does have free wifi that was adequate. Flat screen TV's in the rooms and a gas fireplace set into a brick corner in the (all?) rooms with a glass front panel which is a nice touch. Air conditioning, a separate unit in the room to keep temps acceptable if the fireplace is on, did not work so the first night was warmer than it should have been. Wine tasting in the lobby area every evening - pricey but a nice touch.
reviews.title: It was ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our third and most delightful stop during a week long trip along the coast from LA to San Francisco. This small (34 rooms) boutique hotel was a joy to stay in with a well-appointed room, comfortable bed, and opening picture window to enjoy the outdoors. The lobby bar and sitting room that doubles as a breakfast space was spacious and beautifully designed. A good selection of wine is available; and in the morning the bar is covered with fruits, yogurts, cereals -- something for everyone. The hotel is Eco-friendly and dog-friendly, and the staff was helpful in recommending places to eat in town of Cambria.
reviews.title: Romantic and Pampering Ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night in Cambria but will plan a longer stay the next time to check out more shops and more restaurants. And we'll be back at El Colibri of course!
reviews.title: back again........still loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We found El Colibri almost by accident in May 2011. We had another short stay in November and then again last month. Each visit has been delightful. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and the contemporary decor and furnishings to our taste. Bathroom excellent. The artwork throughout the hotel is interesting and adds character. The continental breakfast is all you need to set you up for a days wine tasting. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. Nothing seems too much trouble and they have always made us feel very welcome. We love Cambria and El Colibri and will come back as soon as we can.
reviews.title: Best choice in Cambria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visit Cambria 2-3 times a year and we've stayed in every single accommodation in town, but we keep coming back to El Colibri. It's the newest, cleanest most modern facility in the town. It's convenient for walking both into town and down to the beach- and while there are no ocean views, we often wake up to see deer in the back garden.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Due to tight road trip schedule, we only stayed 9pm-8am inside the hotel, but a very impressive stay.
reviews.title: A short stay but impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a king suite. It's a spacious room with no door separation but fair good isolation between living and sleeping area. Actually the living area is the sleeping place for our 6mth baby. Our baby liked their leather sofa at least.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the wellness centre, there's an outdoor warm water spa pool and an indoor sauna room. We didn't find them out the night of arrival and didn't have time to use the next morning.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large lounge serving free breakfast; underground parking; free wifi; beautiful gate view...
reviews.title: Relaxing hotel in a relaxing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean modern comfortable and friendly. The room was great as well as the hot tub and common area. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay there!
reviews.title: Great Stay

description: Our wine and appetizer bar offers a variety tastes waiting for you
